pullRequest.title: Movement Handles for Custom Scaffolding
pullRequest.bodyText:
Ladders are hooked through mc using the tag "climbable" and implemented for more specific uses using IForgeBlock::isLadder. This handles fine for scaffolding in most cases as climbing a scaffolding is pretty much the same as a ladder. The only difference in how a user climbs down. For ladders, it is assumed that the player would just stop holding a button. However, scaffolding requires the player to shift, which is not possible for a standard ladder. The value is also hardcoded for Blocks::SCAFFOLDING specifically.
This PR focuses on adding this movement handle in by adding another method into IForgeBlock. There is also code to add in a forge tag as part of the base to allow users the same flexibility as the ladder for a simple or more specific implementation.

commit.message:
Custom Scaffolding Implementation

Handle movement in certain blocks as scaffolding
Add test mod to verify

nodes.bodyText: Why pass all these additional paramteres in when they can be (and are in fact) accessed from LivingEntity?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -911,4 +911,18 @@ default BlockState getToolModifiedState(BlockState state, World world, BlockPos
         else if(toolType == ToolType.HOE) return HoeItem.getHoeTillingState(state);
         else return toolType == ToolType.SHOVEL ? ShovelItem.getShovelPathingState(state) : null;
     }
+    
+    /**
+     * Checks if a player or entity handles movement on this block like scaffolding.
+     *
+     * @param state The current state
+     * @param world The current world
+     * @param pos The block position in world
+     * @param entity The entity on the scaffolding
+     * @return True if the block should act like scaffolding
+     */
+    default boolean isScaffolding(BlockState state, IWorldReader world, BlockPos pos, LivingEntity entity)

nodes.bodyText: This file should no longer be needed, now that you have the generated version
Can you also provide a blockstate data gen?

commit.message:
Removed nongenerated files

Add block state provider for model gen
Remove from test/resources

nodes.bodyText: We DO NOT add tags for game logic.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -911,4 +911,18 @@ default BlockState getToolModifiedState(BlockState state, World world, BlockPos
         else if(toolType == ToolType.HOE) return HoeItem.getHoeTillingState(state);
         else return toolType == ToolType.SHOVEL ? ShovelItem.getShovelPathingState(state) : null;
     }
+    
+    /**
+     * Checks if a player or entity handles movement on this block like scaffolding.
+     *
+     * @param state The current state
+     * @param world The current world
+     * @param pos The block position in world
+     * @param entity The entity on the scaffolding
+     * @return True if the block should act like scaffolding
+     */
+    default boolean isScaffolding(BlockState state, IWorldReader world, BlockPos pos, LivingEntity entity)
+    {
+        return state.isIn(Blocks.SCAFFOLDING) || state.getBlock().isIn(Tags.Blocks.SCAFFOLDING);

commit.message:
Remove direct tag implementation

Move scaffolding tag to test to verify it still works.

nodes.bodyText: Remove all of this entirely. We do not support or encourage people using custom tags for game logic. So there is no need for this 'test'

commit.message:
Remove all references to tags

All tag references have been remove since forge does not support it.

Fix import

ExistingFileHelper for some reason didn't import correctly
